title: Blended and Flipped Learning-Based Mobile Microlearning for Clinical Skills Education

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Conducted in a digital device-provided environment for current practitioners, learning outcomes are measured through project-based assessments. Combines blended learning and flipped learning to balance theory and practice.

learning_goals: Learners can explain clinical skill theories (e.g., blood pressure measurement, injection techniques) with over 90% accuracy using online simulation materials provided via a mobile platform
Learners can perform three or more structured on-site practices based on pre-learned content in a flipped learning format and provide feedback through peer evaluation
Learners can analyze patient data (virtual cases) collected in blended learning environments mathematically and document diagnostic reasoning processes with over 80% accuracy
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
